definitions: To begin a new hobby, sport, or course of study.
To accept an offer or a challenge.
To start to deal with or discuss something.
To shorten a piece of clothing.
examples: She decided to take up painting.
The new sofa will take up too much room.
He took up the job offer immediately.
The committee will take up the issue next week.
I need to take up the hem of these trousers.
